subject: Physical Fitness
title: Telomeres and Exercise
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Telomeres and Exercise.

hook.text: At the end of each chromosome sits a cap called a telomere. It shortens every time a cell divides.

buildup.text: Shorter telomeres are linked to aging, disease, and earlier death. They're a biological clock.

discovery.text: Regular exercisers have telomeres equal to sedentary people ten years younger.

twist.text: Extreme overtraining can shorten telomeres. Moderate exercise protects them; chronic excess harms.

climax.text: Exercise boosts telomerase ‚Äî the enzyme that repairs telomere length. It's the closest anti-aging tool.

punchline.text: Exercise slows your biological clock at the cellular level.

quiz.question: How does moderate exercise affect telomeres?
options: It protects their length via telomerase
